item.title: Jupyter notebooks and docker
item.description: One of the courses I teach at KU Leuven is "Management of Large-Scale Omics Datasets". It’s basically a course focussing on NoSQL databases and mapreduce/spark. We go over document-oriented databases (i.c. mongodb), key-value stores, and graph databases (neo4j). The course also includes several exercise sessions where the students can practise getting information from these datastores. Question is: how to set all this up? Up to 2015, I applied for a teaching grant from Amazon AWS EC2 to run a server with all the necessary software and data installed.
